Description: Rope made from woven lengths of halfa grass (Desmostachya bipinnata). One end of the rope is knotted.
Curator's comments: Ryan & Hansen, A Study of Ancient Egyptian Cordage in the British Museum (Occasional Publication 62, British Museum), p.7,11,12,13,21,22,23,24,25,33,35
On the use of tough grasses for rope in ancient Egypt, see Wendrich, “Basketry” in P.T. Nicholson and I. Shaw, Ancient Egyptian Materials and Technology, 255.
